title: Best Support / Jungle Champions for high ping players
body:
Are there any recommendations for support as well as jungle champs to play when your ping is quite high or spiking? (consider high ping anything between 100 and 999). I would imagine anything without a skillshot will do but Ive found threads saying who not to play yet not a single one stating the best possible options for support or jungle. Up until now I believe that the list should have the following champions:

Support
Kayle, Nunu, Sona (risky but has no skillshots other than her ult), Fiddlesticks, maybe a few of the tankier champs like Braum, Leona and Tahm Kench cause they can take the beating

Jungle
Amumu, Shyvana, Udyr, Volibear, Warwick

Let me know if there are any others or if you would switch some of these out.
Thanks!

replies.body:
Fiddle jungle
Maokai jungle and support
Janna support
Lulu support
Nautilus support and Jungle (his hook is the easiest of the 3 hook champs)
Zac jungle (although it may be hard to land E's)
Taric support (everything has a delay anyways)
Ivern jungle doesnt need ping to make a first clear

I would switch out Kayle because she is basically a utility adc and adc is difficult with high ping (also no clutch ults, zilean would be better if you get skilled with him). I would switch out Nunu because he is only really useful if he counterjungles the enemy and that is difficult o high ping (nunu is really bad as a support too). Amumu would be difficult because he needs to land Q, if you can land those Q's, add bltz to support along with thresh.

For support champs, I find Leona is a safe pick for me when I play on Oceania with my mates in Australia. I get about 200ms latency to that server, so it's still fairly doable. 

Is there a reason we cannot work together to resolve your high latency issue? It's awful to experience high latency, and I wouldn't wish for anyone to have to live with high latency to the server if at all possible.

Let me know what you've already tried to do in order to resolve your issue.
